page.title: 12INLAND WATER
page.content: ECOLOGY. Many streams flowing to the east of the Clwydian range through an area of moorland heather and bracken, have been dammed by the W.W.A. to form reservoirs which add great beauty to this area. ACCESS. The largest of these is the Cilcain no 4 or Garth reservoir, and is reached on foot by a road and track, which climbs steeply from a point to the west of Cilcain village. Cars of authorised people, officials and fishermen with permits only, are allowed beyond this point. USAGE. The water from this reservoir is used to supply areas to the west and north of Mold. It also provides private facilities for fly fishing.
